ygData.subject: Re: Purity belt... *SPOILER*
ygData.msgSnippet: John, Thanks for that info! I was able to get a Bracer by soloing the camp (one member at a time) and totally avoiding Gronit. BUT... I found this thing called
ygData.messageBody:
John,
Thanks for that info! I was able to get a Bracer by soloing the camp (one
member at a time) and totally avoiding Gronit.

BUT... I found this thing called "Pirate earring", which is ALSO a LORE
item. Anyone know what it's for?

Thanks!
Tallonn

-----Original Message-----
From: John Robertson <johnr@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Wednesday, July 14, 1999 11:13 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Purity belt... *SPOILER*



>
>Actually, the stolen item isn't a purity belt, it's the Bracer of Erollisi,
a
>leather wristband that gives +5 strength - a really nice item. Wearable by
all
>leather wearing classes except shadowknights I believe. It's on Captain
>Stoutheart, a mean little halfling who lives in a pup tent on Gornit's
island.
>
>You CAN turn the bracer in for faction and an item (usually something like
a steel
>broadsword), but usually, if you can manage to get the item, you generally
want to
>keep it or sell it. The item is LORE, so you can't have one to wear and
one to
>sell/turn in.
>
>The pirates, btw, aren't really "evil", they're just aligned differently
than the
>wood elves. Killing one will lower your faction with the pirates and with
>Fizzlethorpe, the god of mischief. Most bards won't care about this, but
halfling
>clerics probably would.
>
>Jyzan
>
>
